fence1.title: Electric Concrete
fence1.description: This electric concrete fencing is useful for the more aggressive variety of dinosaurs. It is strong enough and high enough to keep out the Indominus Rex; yet sturdy enough to keep an angry Stegasaurus kept within. Disclaimer: Littlefoot's does not supply the substations, pylons and lines, please refer to our customer service for advice and suggestions.

fence2.title: Concrete
fence2.description: A concrete pen is a suggested pen for medium to large and docile herbivores*. It is also a superb fence for smaller carnivores. Our concrete fencing is our most popular choice, since it can be used for a variety of dinosaurs.

fence3.title: Electric Heavy Steel
fence3.description: The electric heavy steel fencing is a good choice for those on a budget and have herbivores they can trust. For a more visual experience with their new friends, steel fences are good and open choices. Steel fences have been used for carnivores in the past, but we do not suggest it.

fence4.title: Heavy Steel
fence4.description: Heavy steel fences are great for your smaller dinosaurs, including the youngsters and babies. It is also a great option for high visibility.

fence5.title: Gate
fence5.description: Every pen has to have a gate; though, this gate cannot be a simple open and close like ordinary fances have at home. These fences are electric and require power to open. As well, they are heavy duty and meant for all sizes and kinds of dinosaurs.

dinosaur1.name: Ankylosaur
dinosaur1.description: The Ankylosaur is an armoured herbivore. It requires a 60% comfort threshold and an ideal population of 0-8 in a fenced area. It's social requirements are at least 1-f4 other Ankylosaurs; though, it is not uncommon for it to be on it's own. It prefers an equal amount of plains and forest land. The Ankylosaur is susceptible of cryptosporidium and camplybacter. It's grown height is 2.0M, weight is 6.0T, and length 8.0M. The Ankylosaur is not an aggressive dinosaur unless provoked and is much like a cow in it's desire to roam and graze in packs.

dinosaur2.name: Pachycephalosaurus
dinosaur2.description: The Pachycephalosaurus is a small herbivore. It's comfort threshold is a low 25%, which means they need all requirements to be met. They prefer much more grassland in comparison to forest. Their ideal population is 3-10 dinosaurs in a fenced area. Social requirements are at least 3-6. At it's adult size, the Pachycephalosaurus will be 1.4M in height, 450KG in weight and 4.5M in length. It is very important for these dinosaurs to have the appropriate social group or their content level will drop. The Pachycephalosaurus is a great dinosaur to have, but if the content drops, the Pachycephalosaurus can be dangerous due to the bone crown upon it's head. It is susceptible to campylobacter.

dinosaur3.name: Gigantspinosaurus
dinosaur3.description: The Gigantspinosaurus is an armoured herbivore. It's comfort level is 55%. It prefers almost equal grassland and forestland, but prefers the open plains a little more. The ideal population with other dinosaurs ranges from 4-16 if given enough land to roam. It prefers a social group of at least 4-10 others. It is susceptible to bracken poisoning, but is immune to the common cold. It's mature height is 2.3M, weight 700KG and height 8.0M. This particular dinosaur is a beautiful find, but it is imperative for it to have companions, like other social pack creatures.
